answerText: Theodore "Hickey" Hickman [accept any part][10] Hickey and the other denizens of the bar appear in The Iceman Cometh, a play by this American author who also penned Long Day's Journey into Night and Mourning Becomes Electra.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Minnesota A  | 1 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This character's father was an Indiana preacher. For 10 points each: [10] Name this salesman who arrives at Harry Hope's bar, where he eventually admits he murdered his wife. At the end of the play, he realizes that people need to hold onto their pipe dreams.
